plugins.name: Tailwind CSS Styles Generator
plugins.description:
Generate all the Tailwind CSS text, color and shadow styles right into your design panel, created for designers and developers using Tailwind CSS in their amazing projects.


A Little Back Story

I'm a huge fan of Tailwind CSS.


When creating designs where I knew I'll use Tailwind CSS for development, it became frustrating when I had to manually create the styles and copy colors from Tailwind CSS site.


Even more frustrating was when I had to manually create those styles time and again for multiple projects.


That's when the idea of creating this plugin hit my mind.


I searched for pre-existing plugins but they barely provided this functionality.


So, here it is.


Right now it generates only text, color and shadow styles.


Anticipating your comments and ideas on how the plugin can be improved.

plugins.name: Count
plugins.description:
A simple & lightweight utility that counts whatever is in your selection and presents the results depending on the type of layers. No loading times, no UI, no questions asked.


How do I use it?

Just select the thing you want to have counted, and Count will do its best to determine which number you're looking for. Below is a breakdown of all currently supported use cases.


Random

  1. Select multiple layers to get a number of selected layers.
  2. Select nothing (just run the plugin) to get a number of pages, color styles, text styles, effect styles, and grid styles.


Text layers

  1. Select a text layer to get a number of characters, words, and paragraphs.
  2. Select multiple text layers to get a combined number of characters, words, and paragraphs.
  3. Make a selection inside of a text layer to get a number of selected characters.


Frames & groups

  1. Select a frame or a group to get a number of layers directly inside, and a total number of layers inside.


Components

  1. Select a component set to get a number of variants, number of combinations based on your component properties, and a total number of layers inside.


Vector layers

  1. Select a vector layer to get a number of vector points.
  2. Select multiple vector layers to get a combined number of vector points.
plugins.tagline: One command to count it all

plugins.name: Focus CSS
plugins.description:
Focus CSS makes viewing CSS in Figma more convenient and helps you spot inconsistent styling.

Key features:
1. Generate CSS for all elements in a frame, page, selection or for all elements in the whole document.
2. Hide CSS properties you don't want to copy to your project's CSS code.
3. Spot styling errors by viewing only unique values for specific CSS properties.
4. Filter CSS by layer type to, for example, show only the CSS for text layers in a selected frame.

This is a plugin I imagined being useful while working with Figma as a web developer. Please do not hesitate to get in touch if you have any feedback!

plugins.name: Indian User Data Generator
plugins.description:
Generate various types of sample data specific to Indian users.


This plugin includes a comprehensive set of user data generators designed for Indian users.


Workflow


Generate data in your text layers

  1. Select text layers on your Figma page
  2. Click plugin buttons to generate corresponding data items in your text layers


Generate a set of user instances

  1. Open 'Generate user data table' tab of the plugin
  2. Select required fields using the checkboxes. Some basic fields are already checked.
  3. Enter the number of users needed in your table
  4. Click on generate to create a set of users.
  5. It will add a table filled with selected user data to your current Figma page.


Features

  1. Generate unlimited combinations of Indian user data for your design
  2. Add from a range of different data types to your text layers
  3. Configure user tables using many options available and add them to your canvas


Data generators included

  1. First-name, Last-name, Full-name
  2. Date of birth
  3. Email
  4. Mobile
  5. Rural & Urban addresses
  6. City & States
  7. Pin Code
  8. Professions from different domains
  9. Indian Passport numbers
  10. Unique ID (Aadhar) numbers
  11. PAN (Tax ID) numbers
  12. UPI payment address (name & mobile no.)
  13. Driving license (DL) details
  14. Vehicle registration (RC) details
plugins.tagline: Generate unlimited combinations of sample Indian user data

plugins.name: Doodlebug
plugins.description:
Share your mockups directly to Chrome so developers have a pixel-perfect visual reference to build from.

** How it works **

1. When you're ready to share your mockups, use the plugin to create a new screen. You can add mobile, tablet and desktop sizes and notify the developer via email that things are good to go.

2. The developer uses the Chrome plugin to overlay the mockups directly in the browser window as they build. It gives them a pixel-perfect visual guide that makes it easier than ever to match your mocks more closely.

---

Note: The first time you run the plugin in a new file, you'll need to copy the "Share URL" for the Figma file into Doodlebug. This lets Doodlebug keep everything in-sync via the API. It only needs to be done once per file.

plugins.name: Readdy
plugins.description:
Readdy is an website builder tool, now you can use this plugin to export to Figma.


How to Use:

https://help.readdy.ai/en/help/articles/4623808-how-to-export-design


FAQ

1.How export Current Page State to Figma Canvas（What you currently see in your eyes） —including any interactive or dynamically changed content—directly into Figma.


Step 1. Trigger the state of the page to the state you want to export, such as when a pop-up appears or when the second tab is selected.

Step 2. Click the [Export] Button

Step 3. Click Copy

Step 4. Paste to Readdy Figma Plugin


Now, the exact UI state as seen on the page can be exported into Figma.



2.Why can’t export the whole interactions or prototype to Figma?


Because its canvas is a static canvas, it can’t play the prototype or interactions.



You can contact us any time: hi@readdy.ai
plugins.tagline: Export to Figma

plugins.name: Vectaur
plugins.description:
> Unleashing Creative Freedom – Now Free & Open Source


Elevating Your Figma Experience to New Heights


Vectaur is not just a plugin; it's a comprehensive design ecosystem seamlessly integrated into your Figma workspace. With our latest updates, Vectaur is here to redefine your design workflow. From a rich asset library and smart task organizer to innovative AI-powered features, Vectaur is tailored to optimize your creative process, allowing you to concentrate on what you do best: bringing your creative visions to life.


What Vectaur Now Offers:


  • Comprehensive Asset Library: Dive into a rich collection of premium illustrations, vector icons, and gradients – all carefully curated to spark creativity in your designs.
  • Seamless Project Management: Our intuitive in-app to-do list keeps your design process organized, ensuring that your creativity flows uninterrupted.
  • Dynamic Chart Generator: Transform data into visually stunning charts, enhancing the storytelling aspect of your designs.
  • Completely Free and Open Source: Vectaur is now available at no cost, with its source code openly accessible for community contributions and enhancements.
  • Community-Driven Development: Join hands with a global community of designers and developers. Share ideas, improvements, and customizations to continuously evolve Vectaur.


Effortless Start with Vectaur:


  • Install Vectaur: Easily find and install Vectaur in the Figma Community. Embrace a new era of design capabilities in your workspace.
  • Explore and Create: Utilize Vectaur’s enriched "Library" for assets, or activate Image AI for custom illustrations. Tailor everything to your project's aesthetic.
  • Manage Tasks Seamlessly: Leverage the upgraded "Working Task" feature to add, track tasks, and manage deadlines effortlessly, all within Figma.


Support Vectaur


Vectaur is fueled by the support and contributions of our users. While the plugin is entirely free, your donations on GitHub Sponsors help us sustain and improve the project. Every bit of support makes a huge difference!


Join the Vectaur Community


Your feedback, support, and contributions shape the future of Vectaur. Connect with us on GitHub, share your thoughts, and become part of a community that's redefining design tools in Figma.


License Agreement


By using Vectaur, you agree to our licensing terms. Our assets are available for your personal and commercial projects, following our guidelines. Redistribution or resale of any assets is strictly prohibited. For full details, refer to the license terms on this page.


Need Support?


Our community is at the heart of everything we do, and we're always here to assist. For any support, suggestions, or just to say hello, reach out to us in the comments section. At Vectaur, we are committed to enhancing your design journey at every step. Install now and start blending creativity with unparalleled productivity.

plugins.name: (Free) FigJam Dark Mode
plugins.description:
This plugin creates a black transparent background that is bigger than your Figjam board. It is then locked so you can work regularly on-top of it, simulating a dark mode background.


Note: If your content appears behind the dark mode effect, please right-click your content and 'Move to front'!


To remove this effect, you can do any one of the following:

  1. Use 'Undo' (Cmd+Z / Ctrl+Z).
  2. Unlock and delete the large background shapes created by the plugin.
  3. Restore your file using Version History (before the plugin was applied).


This plugin is open-source. Contributions are welcome!

https://github.com/Connagh/figjam-dark-mode/
plugins.tagline: Add a dark background to your FigJam boards!

plugins.name: Mockey AI - Mockup Generator
plugins.description:
Mockey AI - Mockup Generator


You can use Mockey AI's huge collection of realistic mockups right in Figma. Pick from categories like devices, clothing, packaging, and print. Turn your Figma designs into realistic product mockups instantly with one click. New mockups are added every day, so you'll always have fresh options to explore!


How to Use:

  1. In the Plugin & Widgets, choose the Mockey AI plugin to use inside your design files.
  2. After installing, open the Mockey AI and Sign up there.
  3. Pick a category like T-shirts, jackets, or notebooks. Each category has different templates you can change.
  4. Choose a template, then tap Upload Design (like a logo or artwork). The AI will make mockups based on your design.
  5. You can tweak the mockup by changing colors, backgrounds, and AI Photoshoot to match your style. The plugin also lets you remove backgrounds and add different scenes.
  6. Use the Preview to check how your mockup looks before you finish it.
  7. When you're happy with it, hit the Download button to save the mockup in a PNG or JPG format that you can use for presentations or marketing.



Can you make mockups in Figma?

You can make mockups in Figma by adding the Mockey AI plugin. With it, you can choose products like clothes, gadgets, or home items. Pick a mockup template, upload your design, customize it, and export your final mockup easily.


Does Figma have free mockups?

Figma provides free mockups on its community page and through plugins. You can find mockups for t-shirts, smartphones, laptops, tablets, and more. By using templates created by other users or plugins like Mockey AI, you get a wide range of options to display your designs easily.


What is the difference between a prototype and a mockup in Figma?

The main difference between a prototype and a mockup in Figma is how they work and how detailed they are. A mockup is a still picture that shows what the design looks like, with colors and text styles. A prototype, on the other hand, is a clickable version of the design that lets you interact with it and see how it works.


How to find mockups in Figma?

To get mockups in Figma, first, add the Mockey AI plugin from the Figma community. Then, open the plugin and look through tons of mockup options. Finally, pick one and either export it or customize it however you like.
plugins.tagline: It's an AI Mockup generator for everything

plugins.name: Appear 2.0: speed up interface prep for any screen size.
plugins.description:
Preview how fonts and components scale, switch between iOS and Android in one click, and quickly resize screens — all in one powerful Figma plugin.


How It Works:


Set Up Component Naming:

  1. Use identifiers like /ios and /android in your component names.
  2. Example: Button/ios, Button/android.


Save Parent Components:

  1. Open the file with your main components and click “Save main components”.
  2. This step is required for plugins that reference external libraries.


Select & Convert:

  1. Select any frame or components and click “Convert to iOS” or “Convert to Android” to automatically swap instances.


Customize Settings (Optional):

  1. You can change the default identifiers (/ios, /android) to match your own naming convention.
  2. Adjust default screen widths (375 for iOS, 360 for Android).
  3. Enable auto-resizing for screens after conversion.


Naming Rules:

✔️ Good examples:

  1. component_name[ios]
  2. componentname/ios
  3. component(name)-android


❌ Bad examples:

  1. component name ios
  2. ioscomponentnameios
  3. componentname/ios/ios


Identifiers must be unique within the component name and not repeated multiple times.


Important Notes:

Screen resizing works only for frames with resizable content inside.


When components share variant properties, the properties must:

  1. Have identical names
  2. Contain the same value sets
  3. Preferably appear in the same order


Coming Soon:

  1. FAQ Section
plugins.tagline: Scale fonts and components, switch platforms, and resize screens — all in one click.

plugins.name: Content Generator AI
plugins.description:
Introduction


Content Generator AI is a powerful Figma plugin designed to help you generate realistic content for your text layers using AI.


How it works


  1. Select one or multiple text layers.
  2. Run the Content Generator AI plugin.
  3. Describe the kind of content you want to generate.
  4. Click Generate Content!


Note: If you're using this plugin to populate data in a data table, you can only do one column of data at a time. It does not have knowledge or the ability to populate different data for multiple columns at the same time.


Features:


  • Easy-to-Use Interface: Input your OpenAI API key and prompt directly in the plugin's UI.
  • Dynamic Content Generation: Generate text content based on custom prompts provided by you.
  • Auto Close Option: Optionally auto-close the plugin after content generation.
  • Prompt History: Displays your previous prompts to re-run them quickly.
  • Search: Search your prompt history.
  • Seamless Integration: Apply generated content directly to the selected text layers in your Figma file.


Requirements


You MUST have an OpenAI project API key (it looks like "sk-proj-") and have some credits/money loaded into your OpenAI account in order to use this plugin. Sign up at OpenAI to obtain your API key.


Sample Content Prompts


  • Random, diverse full names
  • Phone numbers from Cupertino
  • Random numbers between 75.0% and 100% to one decimal place
  • Random statuses from the following: Complete, Pending, Error
  • Timestamps in the format mm/dd/yyyy, hh:mm AM


Support

For any issues or support, send me a DM on Twitter @thejmoore.

accepted.name: Jon Moore
accepted.description: Principal, Product Design, AI Platform at Salesforce

plugins.tagline: Generate realistic text content with AI

plugins.name: Felix AI - Design Copilot
plugins.description:
Felix is a context-aware reasoning application, a digital assistant powered by GPT-4o that can understand your design selections in Figma. You can generate code, request specific tasks in relation to your selections right in Figma!


Felix was created to assist in the software development workflow, and is intended to assist designers and engineers alike in translating designs into the structured information you need.


Felix now supports multi-message chat threads, and comes with Tools; prebuilt prompts that enable you to get started on a number of tasks:


  1. Programming a design with CSS/HTML/JS
  2. Programming a design with React and Tailwind
  3. UX research protocols
  4. Complexity Estimates for Planning
  5. Converting a Design into React


felixforfigma.com


How it Works

Just select a screen or component, type in a question or request, and click the send button, and right away you’ll see the response stream in.


Felix collects and structures the information within your designs, and works with an AI language model to provide insights and perform tasks with your exact design.


Felix can give thorough feedback, call out potential accessibility issue areas, convert designs to code, generate UX research protocols, generate mock data based on given fields, create alternative copy, and anything else you can think of!


Getting Started

You’ll need an OpenAI API key to get started. You can get one easily from their platform site. Sign up for an OpenAI API key here.


Other than the cost for generations, Felix AI is free to use!

(I'll soon release subscriptions and services to simplify the process.)


There’s a maximum to the context windows of each model, so for now Felix handles a few screens or components at a time. Costs are in the cents per generation. GPT-3.5 is great for easy questions, and prices can range from 1-2 cents per generation.


GPT-4 is much smarter and can handle complex tasks like those in the Tools, and will cost anywhere from 2 to 15 cents or so with a large selection. It depends on the complexity and size of the design.



Security

Design selection data is only sent upon clicking the send button, and OpenAI doesn't train with data sent to their API, and neither does Felix.


You’ll need to keep your API key private, and I recommend setting a low spend limit of around $10.00 on their website before getting started for peace of mind!


Thank you for taking a look and feel free to rea﻿ch out to me on Twitter with any feedback or bugs!
plugins.tagline: The Context Aware Reasoning Application & AI Design Assistant

plugins.name: Content Auto with AI
plugins.description:
The "Real Ipsum AI Generator | AI Powered Random Content Creator" Figma plugin leverages the power of AI to accelerate your design processes and boost your creativity. This plugin, with its slogan "Free AI Powered Random Content Creator with One Click," offers a user-friendly experience by generating unique and engaging textual content for your project designs with just a single click.


Eliminating the frequent challenge designers face in finding and placing realistic text content, the Real Ipsum AI Generator provides customizable content for all types of projects. Capable of producing a wide range of content types—from blog posts and product descriptions to user comments and beyond—this plugin brings your design prototypes closer to real-world scenarios.


This plugin's extremely easy-to-use feature allows designers to focus on enhancing the quality of their actual designs, rather than spending time on text content. plugins.name: Tidy Hues
plugins.description:
Tidy Hues is a Figma plugin that allows you change just the hue of any layers you have selected.


Getting Started

When you first start the plugin, you will be greeted with an interface that has a number input, a slider, and an Apply button. As soon as you enter a number in the text field or use the slider, the button will change to the color of your currently selected hue.


If you select some layers in your file that have any Solid or Gradient fills, and hit the Apply button, it will change all of the hue values of the colors in those layers to the hue you have selected in the plugin. The saturation, lightness, and opacity of your layers will all remain the same.


Found a bug or have an idea?

This is a team of one, but if you have any good ideas or constructive feedback, please do not hesitate to share your thoughts by creating a new issue - screen captures are welcomed.


Show your support

If you find this plugin useful, feel free to buy me a 🍺 at my Patreon page. Thanks! 🙏


Contribute

  • Run yarn to install dependencies.
  • Run yarn build:watch to start webpack in watch mode.
  • Open Figma > Plugins > Development > New Plugin... and choose manifest.json file from this repo.
  • Create a Pull Request for your branch

plugins.name: Storyboard Creator
plugins.description:
This plugin makes it easier to build storyboards and format them for export within Figma.


INSTRUCTIONS: 

  1. Create a new Filmstrip from the plugin menu.
  2. Build your sequence in the Filmstrip. Compose your image within the Image object of each Frame. Frames can be rearranged, added, and deleted as you’d like.
  3. When you’re done composing, select your Filmstrip and use the “Create Storyboard from Filmstrip” menu item to generate a formatted Storyboard.
  4. Iterate on the Filmstrip and regenerate Storyboards as you’d like!


ADDITIONAL FEATURES / NOTES:

  1. From the menu, you can create an additional Frame of common film aspect ratios. You can drag these into your filmstrip and duplicate to change your Storyboard’s aspect ratio, or mix & match.
  2. By default, the plugin will automatically number your frames in the order they appear in the Filmstrip. You can override these numbers by unlocking the “#.” text object and editing the text to whatever label you’d like.


See an example at this demo file.


I made this to enable a personal workflow for making and laying out storyboards in Figma. Maybe someone else will find it useful too! :)

plugins.name: Make Color Styles
plugins.description:
When you run this plugin, it looks through all your selection colors, and if there are any that aren't yet saved fill styles (or color styles, or Paint Styles as they're officially called), it saves them with the name of the element that has that fill.


This means you can make a lot of frames as swatches, name them all the way you want their color styles to be named, and save all the colors at once by selecting them together and running this plugin.


🎥 Here is a demo video showing how to use the plugin.


I made this to be able to move faster as I iterate on color palettes for kittycad.io. Come check out what we're building, it's infrastructure for hardware design tools!
plugins.tagline: Turn any unsaved fills in your selection into saved paint styles (aka color styles)

plugins.name: Smoothing Uncapped
plugins.description:
Enhance Figma's corner smoothing on large rounded corners


The problem

Have you ever noticed that Figma's corner smoothing doesn't seem to work well on big rounded corners? As the radius gets bigger, the effect becomes less noticeable.


Usage

Pick a rectangle with a large corner radius. Make sure "corner smoothing" is not 0%.

Right-click on the rectangle and select "Smoothing Uncapped" from the menu.

plugins.name: Yunser Design
plugins.description:
Quickly generate components.


快速生成组件。


selecting a layer, click the button to generate it.


选择图层，快速生成组件并替换图层。



## Commands


* `Auto Layout Fixed Size`: Set auto layout to fixed width and height.

* `1/2 width of parent`: Set the layer width to 1/2 of the parent layer.

* `1/3 width of parent`: Set the layer width to 1/3 of the parent layer.

* `1/4 width of parent`: Set the layer width to 1/4 of the parent layer.

* `Frame All`: Wrap frame to all selected layers.

* `Swap Position`: Select two layers to swap them.



========·========



## 功能说明


该插件致力于让设计更加快速化、工程化。目前功能还很简陋，很多功能还在试探。


插件提供了一些常用的快速命令，让设计更加高效，让我们尽可能摆脱鼠标工作。



## 支持的命令：


* `Auto Layout Fixed Size`: 设置自动布局为固定宽高。

* `1/2 width of parent`: 设置图层宽度为父图层的 1/2。

* `1/3 width of parent`: 设置图层宽度为父图层的 1/3。

* `1/4 width of parent`: 设置图层宽度为父图层的 1/4。

* `Frame All`: 把所有选中的图层用 Frame 包裹起来。

* `Swap Position`: 选中两个图层，交换位置。

* `Radius xx`: 选中多个图层，快速设置圆角。

* 开发常用

* `Copy as DataUrl`: 复制为 Data URL，可用于网页图片 `src`。

* `Copy as Path Data`: 复制为 svg path 的 `d` 属性。

plugins.name: Image Wrap
plugins.description:
Image Wrapper allows you to use shapes as masks. Quickly.


To use it, simply:

  1. Select any Frame, Shape or Text in Figma.
  2. Drag and Drop an image onto the plugin.


Image Wrapper supports 2 operating modes:


“Use selection as mask”

The plugin will automatically create a mask group and insert the image, taking care of any resizing necessary.


“Fill selection with image"

This is the same as manually creating an Image Paint in the properties panel, except it’s much faster.

plugins.name: Color Contrast Grid
plugins.description:
Not sure if the color you are using meets the contrast ratio?

Try this plug-in.

It outputs the contrast ratios for all possible combinations of color styles.


Main Functions

  • Generates a table of contrast ratios for all local color styles
  • Flexible as each part is componentized
  • Enables to limit the display according to the contrast.


Future updates

  • Allow output of exact contrast ratio values for colors with opacity less than 100%.
  • Allows you to add colors manually.


Bug reports and feedback welcome!


自分の使っているカラーがコントラスト比を満たしているかわからない？

そんな時はこのプラグインを使ってみましょう。

plugins.name: Stretch — by ‹div›RIOTS
plugins.description:
You thought native stretching and transform was impossible in Figma ? think again.


Stretch applies a scaled transformation to Figma layers stored in your clipboard, so you can paste them back on your canvas fully scaled (and still editable).


What can you stretch?

  1. Text layers
  2. Vectors
  3. Entire frames


How it works:

  1. Copy the layer(s) to your clipboard (CTRL+C / ⌘+C)
  2. Paste your layer in the plugin (if in the browser, you'll have to hit CTRL+V / ⌘+V afterwards, as the plugin can't access the clipboard automatically).
  3. Select the axis and factor you want for the transformation.
  4. Click Stretch to clipboard
  5. Paste the transformed layer back onto your canvas


Enjoy a fully-stretched layer that’s 100% editable!

plugins.tagline: Stretch your figma layers natively

67207.name: Stretch — by ‹div›RIOTS
67207.description:
You thought native stretching and transform was impossible in Figma ? think again.


Stretch applies a scaled transformation to Figma layers stored in your clipboard, so you can paste them back on your canvas fully scaled (and still editable).


What can you stretch?

  1. Text layers
  2. Vectors
  3. Entire frames


How it works:

  1. Copy the layer(s) to your clipboard (CTRL+C / ⌘+C)
  2. Paste your layer in the plugin (if in the browser, you'll have to hit CTRL+V / ⌘+V afterwards, as the plugin can't access the clipboard automatically).
  3. Select the axis and factor you want for the transformation.
  4. Click Stretch to clipboard
  5. Paste the transformed layer back onto your canvas


Enjoy a fully-stretched layer that’s 100% editable!
